com.duke.maps

Class DMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.duke.maps.DMap

  • public class DMap
extends java.lang.Object
    Extendable map class, stands for Duke Map.
    Author:
    Duke

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected int height
      Height of map.
      protected Tile[][] tiles
      Tiles contained within map.
      protected int width
      Width of map.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DMap(DMap m)
      Really just a copy constructor.
      DMap(int w, int h)
      Basically makes a map that you can mess around with the tiles.
      DMap(MapGenerator gen)
      Used to generate a random map using MapGenerator.
      DMap(Tile[][] tiles)
      Constructor that essentially copies the inputted Tile 2D array to itself Determines width and height based on inputted tiles size.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DMap

        public DMap(Tile[][] tiles)
        Constructor that essentially copies the inputted Tile 2D array to itself Determines width and height based on inputted tiles size.
        Parameters:
        tiles - Tiles to be copied into the map.

      • DMap

        public DMap(DMap m)
        Really just a copy constructor.
        Parameters:
        m - Map that is to be copied.

      • DMap

        public DMap(MapGenerator gen)
        Used to generate a random map using MapGenerator. Uses MapGenerator's build method to copy returned DMap to this map.
        Parameters:
        gen - MapGenerator to generate random map.
        See Also:
        MapGenerator}

      • DMap

        public DMap(int w,
            int h)
        Basically makes a map that you can mess around with the tiles. Initializes tiles, then defines them to be Tile.BOUNDS
        Parameters:
        w - width of map
        h - height of map
